claim.statement: Social distancing measures introduced by governments reduce the mobility in the concerned cities.
claim.hypothesis: The introduction of social distancing measures is associated with a decrease in mobility.

method.description: The effect of time and social distancing measures was estimated using a multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model.
steps: Classify cities based on social distancing measures.
Use multilevel mixed-effects linear regression to estimate effects.

results.summary: Social distancing measures decreased the mobility by an additional 23% (95%CI: 20%, 27%).

metadata.original_paper_title: COVID-19 related social distancing measures and reduction in city mobility

analysis.instructions: Use multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model to estimate the effect of time and governmental social distancing measures on mobility.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Coefficient of the lockdown variable, p-value, confidence interval
